thread.title: Report: Flynn denied Russia sanctions talks to FBI | Washington Examiner
thread.title_full: Report: Flynn denied Russia sanctions talks to FBI | Washington Examiner

author: Daniel Chaitin
title: Report: Flynn denied Russia sanctions talks to FBI | Washington Examiner
text:
Mike Flynn denied to the the Federal Bureau of Investigation that he communicated with a Russian envoy about sanctions, according to a report Thursday.
The latest revelation in the Flynn scandal could put the former Trump national security adviser in legal trouble, as lying to the FBI is a felony.
Any decision to prosecute Flynn would fall to the Justice Department.
Unnamed current and former U.S. officials told the Washington Post that during a Jan. 24 interview with FBI agents that Flynn denied that he spoke about sanctions with Russian Ambassador Sergey Kislyak before Trump's inauguration.

Several leaks had already gotten Flynn into trouble over misleading Vice President Mike Pence about the subjects broached while communicating with Kislyak.
Flynn resigned Monday amid the flurry of leaks and the Justice Department expressing concern that he might be vulnerable to blackmail by the Russians.
